questions.text: A 75-year-old male presents with an acute stroke. On examination he has mild right arm and face weakness. He has spontaneous speech with occasional paraphasic errors. questions.correct_answer: B. Continue valproate with monitoring of drug level

questions.text: A 26-year-old male resident is noticed by his attending physician to have yellow eyes after his 24hour call period. When asked, the resident states he has no medical history, but on occasion, he has thought he might have mild jaundice when he is stressed or has more than four to five alcoholic drinks. He never sought medical treatment because he was uncertain, and his eyes would return fully to normal within 2 days. He denies nausea, abdominal pain, dark urine, light-colored stools, pruritus, or weight loss. On examination, he has a BMI of 20.1 kg/m2. Scleral icterus is present. There are no stigmata of chronic liver disease. Laboratory examinations are normal except for a total bilirubin of 3.0 mg/dL. Direct bilirubin is 0.2 mg/dL. Reactive arthritis associated with the recent enteric infection is suspected. Which of the following is true about this condition?

questions.correct_answer: D. Synovial fluid shows an elevated leukocyte count

questions.text: A 33-year-old woman is seen in your office for evaluation of fatigue, malaise, and mild right upper quadrant discomfort, ongoing for the past 1 month. Her medical history is notable for hypothyroidism, and her only medication is levothyroxine. Her examination result is notable only for mildly tender hepatomegaly. On further questioning, she reports no risk factors for viral hepatitis. She does not consume alcohol or illicit drugs. Her mother has lupus, and a maternal aunt has rheumatoid arthritis. Laboratory test results are notable for ALT 480 U/L, AST 211 U/L, total bilirubin 0.4 mg/dL, alkaline phosphatase 89 U/L, total protein 9.1 g/dL, albumin 4.1 g/dL, and TSH 2.1 µIU/mL. Her anti smooth muscle antibody titre is elevated. Which of the following statements about her likely diagnosis is true?

options.label: A
options.text: This condition most often occurs in men.

options.label: B
options.text: Treatment of choice is prednisone with azathioprine.

options.label: C
options.text: There is a very low risk of developing cirrhosis.

options.label: D
options.text: It does not recur after liver transplant

questions.correct_answer: B. Treatment of choice is prednisone with azathioprine.

questions.text: A 62-year-old man with chronic hepatitis C–associated cirrhosis presents to the emergency room with confusion and abdominal pain. He is noted to have ascites and asterixis. Which statement is true regarding care of this patients?

options.label: A
options.text: Patients with ascites fluid total protein <1.1 g/dL and serum bilirubin >2.5 mg/dL should receive prophylactic antibiotics as risk of SBP is high

options.label: B
options.text: Endoscopic variceal sclerotherapy is the preferred option for secondary prophylaxis of variceal haemorrhage

options.label: C
options.text: If Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) score more than 10 consider liver transplant

questions.correct_answer: A. Patients with ascites fluid total protein <1.1 g/dL and serum bilirubin >2.5 mg/dL should receive prophylactic antibiotics as risk of SBP is high

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman with prior history of IV drug abuse resulting in hepatitis C coinfection is seen in a prenatal clinic for routine care. She is in the third trimester of pregnancy with her first child. Which of the following statements regarding transmission of hepatitis C virus (HCV) to neonate is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Caesarean section reduces the risk of transmission to a greater degree than vaginal delivery.

options.label: B
options.text: Risk of transmission is 5% to neonate.

options.label: C
options.text: Breastfeeding is associated with very high risk of transmission.

options.label: D
options.text: Patients with HCV genotype 1 have a greater risk of transmission than other genotypes

questions.correct_answer: B. Risk of transmission is 5% to neonate.

A 30-years-old lady presents with features of malabsorption and iron deficiency anaemia. Duodenal biopsy shows complete villus atrophy. Which of the following antibodies is likely to be present?
Stool osmotic gap is calculated as

options.label: A
options.text: Serum osmolarity – (2 X [fecal sodium + potassium concentration])

options.label: B
options.text: Stool osmolarity – (2 X [fecal sodium + potassium concentration])

options.label: C
options.text: Serum osmolarity – (2 X [serum sodium + potassium concentration])

questions.correct_answer: A. Serum osmolarity – (2 X [fecal sodium + potassium concentration])

It can be used effectively in Type 1 DM patients 4. It can increase risk of Medullary carcinoma of thyroid 5. It reduces risk of cardiovascular mortality in Type 2 DM patients

Which of the following conditions and drugs can cause secondary hyperlipidemia?

options.label: A
options.text: Hypothyroidism, nephritic syndrome, Cushing’s syndrome, thiazide diuretics and B-blockers

options.label: B
options.text: Hyperthyroidism, nephritic syndrome, uncontrolled diabetes and steroids.

options.label: C
options.text: Hyperthyroidism, acute viral hepatitis, loop diuretics, and alcohol abuse

options.label: D
options.text: Hyperthyroidism, adrenal insufficiency, uremia and contraceptive steroids

questions.correct_answer: A. Hypothyroidism, nephritic syndrome, Cushing’s syndrome, thiazide diuretics and B-blockers

questions.text: A Patient presents with prognathism, enlarged hand & feet.Most likely transcription factor involved in the disorder is
A 45-year-old female presents with weight gain & lethargy on investigations her TSH levels are high & T4 levels are low. Likely diagnosis for her clinical condition is
Causes of secondary hyper parathyroidism are all EXECEPT?
Which of the following statements are true of primary hyperparathyroidism?

options.label: A
options.text: It is associated with hypocalciuria due to elevated PTH levels.

options.label: B
options.text: PTH is secreted in a pulsatile manner from the posterior pituitary and acts through PTH receptors on parathyroid cell membranes

options.label: C
options.text: It is usually caused by an adenoma of a single parathyroid gland

options.label: D
options.text: It progresses to tertiary hyperparathyroidism with time

questions.correct_answer: C. It is usually caused by an adenoma of a single parathyroid gland

questions.text: Empty sella syndrome is often characterized by
True regarding pseudohypoparathyroidism include all except

options.label: A
options.text: It is due to end organ insensitivity.

options.label: B
options.text: Associated with low levels of calcium and high phosphate.

options.label: C
options.text: Albright dystrophy is associated with pseudohypoparathyroidism.

questions.correct_answer: D. Reduces serum level of PTH.

questions.text: A 21 yr patient presents with complaint of primary amenorrhoea. Her height is 153cm, weight is 51 kg. She has well developed breast. She has no pubic hair or axillary hair and hirsuitism. Which of the following is the most probable diagnosis?

An AIDS patient presents to OPD with a 2 month history of watery, nonbloody diarrhea. The stool reveals acid fast oocysts of 6 µm size. All are characteristic except

options.label: B
options.text: Macrolides is the treatment of choice

options.label: D
options.text: Ag detection in stool and direct fluorescence testing are alternative methods of detection

questions.correct_answer: B. Macrolides is the treatment of choice

options.label: B
options.text: Absence of meningeal signs indicates poor prognosis

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: B. Absence of meningeal signs indicates poor prognosis

questions.text: A 30- year old man is noted to be hypertensive. A complete blood count reveals mild leukocytosis, hematocrit of 55% ,and thrombocytosis. Uric acid is elevated and ultrasound confirms splenomegaly. Comment on the diagnosis
Which of the following is the preferred agent for the treatment for invasive aspergillosis?
Which of the following is the most predisposing genetic deficiency predisposing an individual to disseminated non tuberculous mycobacterial infection?
True statement about adequate CPR are all EXCEPT

A Dengue patient, 24 hours without fever, no nausea/vomiting. Had epistaxis which resolved spontaneously. Hemodynamically stable. Lab is normal except platelet count of 14000. Which is correct statement regarding further management?
Anaemia with hyperpigmented knuckles

A 26-year-old man is found to have acute leukemia. Three weeks after initiation of chemotherapy he has a body temperature spike to 38.9 C (102 F), with a white blood cell count of 500/mm. Which of the following is true regarding this clinical situation?

options.label: A
options.text: Antibiotics should be given if a source of infection can be identified

options.label: B
options.text: Normal chest roentgenographic findings would eliminate pneumonia as the cause of the fever

options.label: C
options.text: Bacteremia, if present, would most likely be caused by pseudomonas and other gram-negative bacilli

options.label: D
options.text: Chemotherapy and tumor lysis are the most likely cause of fever

questions.correct_answer: C. Bacteremia, if present, would most likely be caused by pseudomonas and other gram-negative bacilli

questions.text: A 60-year-old man with malignant lymphoma presents with the findings seen in the picture given below. These findings last for 2 to 4 days and recur periodically. This condition differs from its related hereditary form by low levels of
Inherited causes of Aplastic anaemia are all except:
Assertion : Microalbuminuria is a sensitive marker of DM nephropathy Reason : Diabetes predisposes to atherosclerosis leading to Renal artery stenosis

options.label: A
options.text: Both Assertion and Reason are independently true statements and the reason is the correct explanation for the assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Both assertion and reason are independently correct statements but the reason is not the correct explanation for the assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is independently a true statement, but the reason is independently a false statement

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is independently a false statement, but the reason is independently a true statement

options.label: E
options.text: Both assertion and reason are false statements

questions.correct_answer: B. Both assertion and reason are independently correct statements but the reason is not the correct explanation for the assertion

questions.text: 45yrs. Male presented with nephrotic syndrome. His BP was 140/100mm of Hg. He has no history of DM/HTN. He however gives history of low-grade fever, loss of appetite and weight loss over the past 6 months. Laboratory tests revealed a normal Creatinine levels with low C3 levels. Renal biopsy was done and IF staining for C3 revealed the following. What is diagnosis?

A 75-year-old lady with fracture neck of femur presents with two days history altered sensorium and decreased urinary output. Serum calcium is 15.5 mg/dl, urea is 140 mg/dl, creatinine is 2 mg/dl. All of the following are useful for immediate, management of hypercalcemia, Except
The most reliable test for detection of Microalbuminuria is

options.label: B

questions.text: A 60year old woman is admitted with sudden onset of chest pain and is diagnosed with an acute myocardial infarction. Her acute illness is complicated by low blood pressure and poor tissue perfusion for several days. Her serum Urea and Creatinine are noted to be increasing. On day 1 – Urea – 8, Creatinine – 1.16 Day 2 – Urea – 22 Creatinine – 1.40 Day 3- Urea – 30 creatinine -2.0 Granular and Hyaline cast are present in the urine. On examination he was found to have high BP , features of inflammatory arthritis in large joints , gangrene in 2 fingers of upper limb and a skin lesion as given in the picture below. The following statements are true regarding Sjogren’s syndrome EXCEPT

options.label: A
options.text: Primary Sjogren’s is associated with increased risk of systemic manifestations

options.label: B
options.text: Secondary Sjogren’s has increased risk of lymphoma

options.label: C
options.text: Elderly onset of disease has poorer prognosis

options.label: D
options.text: High SSA antibody titres is associated with increased risk of lymphoma

questions.correct_answer: B. Secondary Sjogren’s has increased risk of lymphoma

questions.text: A 74-year-old female presented with sudden onset pain and swelling in the left knee. On examination she is afebrile. X-ray shows chondrocalcinosis. Microscopic analysis of the synovial fluid is most likely to show:

options.label: C
options.text: Rhomboidal, weakly positive birefringent crystals under polarising microscopy

options.label: D
options.text: Needle shaped, strongly negative birefringent crystals under polarising microscopy

questions.correct_answer: C. Rhomboidal, weakly positive birefringent crystals under polarising microscopy

questions.text: Most likely diagnosis associated with following pattern of ANA immunofluorescence is

options.label: C

Following statements about Drug Induced Lupus are True 1. DIL affects Males>Females 2. It frequently causes Renal Failure 3. Steroids are indicated for treatment along-with withdrawal of the drug 4. Serum Complement levels are normal 5. Anti-dsDNA antibody is negative

The following statement/s are true regarding the 2019 updated guidelines for SLE diagnosis

options.label: A
options.text: ANA positivity is mandatory for diagnosis

options.label: B
options.text: Fever is not a part of diagnostic guidelines

options.label: C
options.text: Direct Coomb’s test maybe used for diagnosis

questions.correct_answer: A. ANA positivity is mandatory for diagnosis

Following statements about SLE are true EXCEPT

options.label: A
options.text: IV Methylprednisolone is preferred drug in emergency

options.label: B
options.text: Belimumab is an approved anti-CD20 antibody for SLE treatment

options.label: C

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: B. Belimumab is an approved anti-CD20 antibody for SLE treatment
